Antibodies.description: Proteins produced by the immune system to identify and neutralize foreign substances

B Cell Activation.description: The process by which B cells are stimulated to produce antibodies

Antigen Binding.description: The binding of an antibody to its specific antigen

Plasma Cell Differentiation.description: The differentiation of B cells into plasma cells, which are antibody factories

Memory B Cell Formation.description: The formation of memory B cells, which provide long-lasting immunity

Antibody Production.description: The production of antibodies by plasma cells

Complement Activation.description: The activation of the complement system, leading to the destruction of pathogens

Opsonization.description: The coating of pathogens with antibodies, making them more susceptible to phagocytosis

Secondary Immune Response.description: A faster and stronger immune response upon re-exposure to the same antigen

Neutralization.description: The inactivation of pathogens by antibodies

Agglutination.description: The clumping of pathogens by antibodies

Cell Lysis.description: The destruction of pathogens by the complement system

Phagocytosis.description: The ingestion of pathogens by phagocytic cells

Faster and Stronger Response.description: Improved immunity due to the faster and stronger secondary immune response

Inactivation of Pathogens.description: Antibodies prevent pathogens from infecting cells

Clumping of Pathogens.description: Antibodies clump pathogens together, making them easier to eliminate

Pathogen Destruction.description: Pathogens are destroyed by the complement system
